meanings.definition: Preventing the formation of lumps or clumps
meanings.sent1: The anticaking powder kept the sugar smooth and free of lumps.
meanings.sent2: The anticaking agent in the salt ensured it poured easily from the shaker.
meanings.sent3: The anticaking treatment made the soil so slippery that even the worms couldn't stick together!
meanings.sent4: Her anticaking skills in organizing the books prevented any clutter from forming on the shelves.
meanings.sent5: The anticaking magic in the paint made sure there were no clumps on the walls, giving a perfect finish.

meanings.definition: A substance added to prevent clumping
meanings.sent1: The cook added anticaking to the flour to keep it from sticking together.
meanings.sent2: The anticaking in the detergent stopped the powder from forming into hard chunks.
meanings.sent3: The anticaking ingredient in the shampoo made sure it didn't turn into a solid block.
meanings.sent4: The anticaking agent in the spices kept them loose and easy to sprinkle.
meanings.sent5: The anticaking compound in the protein powder prevented it from becoming a solid mass.
